thread.title: Suicide bomb attack on warship ‘meant for US’ – escalating WW3 fears
thread.title_full: Suicide bomb attack on warship ‘meant for US’ – escalating WW3 fears

title: Suicide bomb attack on warship ‘meant for US’ – escalating WW3 fears
text:
Suicide bomb attack on warship ‘meant for US’ – escalating WW3 fears Suicide bomb attack on warship ‘meant for US’ – escalating WW3 fears A SUICIDE attack on a Saudi Arabian vessel by Iranian allies may have been meant for US warships, defence officials have claimed. / Published 1st February 2017 
Dramatic footage shows suicide boats launching a “three-pronged attack” on the Saudi Arabian warship, causing a massive explosion off the coast of Yemen on Monday. 
But American intelligence officials now believe the Iran-allied Houthi attackers for may have mistaken the ship for a US vessel. 
Earlier this week, I ran launched a ballistic missile in defiance of a UN agreement sparking fears it was a “nuke warning shot” to president Donald Trump. 
YOUTUBE NUCLEAR WAR? Iran defied the UN as they launched a ballistic missile on Sunday 
Both incidents come days after The Donald angered Iran and other Middle Eastern countries by banning their citizens from the US for 90 days. 
According to a defence official, the Pentagon believes the Houthi militants, who are also allies with North Korea, thought they were striking an American vessel. 
Video analysts claim a voice can be heard shouting in Arabic, "Allahu Akbar, death to America, death to Israel, a curse on the Jews and victory for Islam" as the warship explodes. 
YOUTUBE EXPLOSION: Iran-allied Houthi attackers launched suicide boat bombs at the warship Who has Nukes? These are the countries in the world's nuclear weapons club. 1 / 6 Getty Images According to 2016 data from the Federation of American Scientists, the United States has an estimated inventory of 7,000 nuclear warheads, with 1,750 of them strategically deployed. 
The attack, near the Gulf of Aden, occurred in the same area where US Navy warships came under missile attack in October last year. 
Defence analysts added the latest attack could have been a "dress rehearsal" for future action. 
It comes as US officials promised America will act in response to the recent missile launch. 
GOOGLE MAPS LOCATION: The suicide attack near the Gulf of Aden where US warships frequent Donald Trump's TERRIFYING future weapons Wednesday, 18th January 2017 As Donald Trump has promised to start an arms race, we take a look at the futuristic weapons being developed for the US military. 1 / 9 Alamy Stock Photo A projectile fired from an electromagnetic rail gun. Rail Guns use an electro magnet to propel a projectile at speeds up to 2500 meters per second. 
US State Department spokesman Mark Toner said: "The US is well aware of and deeply troubled by Iran's longstanding provocative and irresponsible activities." 
The US ambassador to the UN, Nikki Haley, added: "This is absolutely unacceptable. We will act accordingly. We will be loud." Related articles
